Key Match Events: Matt Wallner homered for the second straight game
Brooks Lee snapped an 0-for-19 stretch with a go-ahead, two-run double
Royce Lewis nearly had his sixth career grand slam
Taylor Ward led off the game with his 23rd homer
Willi Castro had an RBI single to snap an 0-for-16 skid
Nolan Schanuel had his 13th homer of the season among three hits
Jordyn Adams added his first career homer for Los Angeles
Zebby Matthews started and allowed two runs in just 3 1/3 innings
Cole Sands (7-1) pitched 2/3 of an inning in relief
Jhoan Duran surrendered three hits in the ninth, but secured his 23rd save
Pre-Game Insights: Minnesota manager Rocco Baldelli said the team felt good and had good energy and at-bats
Los Angeles manager Ron Washington said OF Bryce Teodosio sustained a small finger fracture on a bunt attempt a night earlier
Post-Match Reflections: Matt Wallner said the team felt good and guys getting hits and driving guys in was huge for them
Rocco Baldelli said the offense was brewing and the guys were locked in and doing their part
Jordyn Adams said it felt good to hit his first career homer and he was just trying not to miss it
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins remain six games behind Cleveland and 1 1/2 behind Kansas City in the AL Central
They are three ahead of Detroit for the final AL wild-card spot
Brandon Drury left the game in the fifth inning with left hamstring tightness
Byron Buxton (right hip inflammation) will be activated from the 10-day injured list prior to Friday's game
Austin Martin will be sent to Triple-A St. Paul in a corresponding move
OF Manuel Margot was reinstated from the injured list after missing 10 games with a right groin strain
C Christian Vázquez was also reinstated from the paternity list
C Jaír Camargo and utility player Michael Helman were optioned to Triple-A
